newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU foreign policy a shambles, say Euro-MPs.
newsitem.headline: EU foreign policy a shambles, say Euro-MPs.

text.p: The European Parliament on Thursday attacked the European Union's "unimpressive" foreign policy record during 1996.

The EU failed to agree on a united stance on Bosnia- Herzogovina, Central Africa or China, it was ineffectual in its response to the crises in Albania, the Middle East, Cyprus and Turkey, and was simply paralysed when it came to Algeria, the parliament said in a report by British Conservative Tom Spencer.

"The common foreign and security policy (CFSP)...is a story of institutional timidity and occasional failure of European solidarity under commercial pressures," Spencer, the head of the EU assembly's foreign affairs committee, told Euro-MPs on Wednesday.
Spencer urged EU leaders to adopt a more effective approach to foreign policy at their Amsterdam summit next week and to use the powers they had to act effectively.
EU leaders meet in Amsterdam next Monday and Tuesday to agree a package of wide-ranging reforms to the EU treaty which includes proposals for making the CFSP more effective.
(See also BC-PARLIAMENT-FOREIGN POLICY which moved on Wednesday and BC-PARLIAMENT-CHINA which moved on Thursday.)
